comment.author: 67507070@N00
comment._content: Boston Evening Transcript, Dec 23 1903 A BRITISH SHIP DISMASTED The "Olive Bank", Long Overdue, Arrives at San Francisco San Francisco, Dec 23. The British ship Olive Bank, sixty days out from Shanghai, for Royal Roads, B. C., is entering this port with three of her four lower masts broken off below the tops under a jury rig. The ship which sailed from Shanghai in ballast on Oct 26, ran into a succession of terrific gales after being out one month and practically rolled her spars overboard ... The Olive Bank was built in 1892 at Port Glasgow at a cost of $90,000. news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2249&dat=19031223&...
